alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Jennings; Lawrence (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 9:49AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lawrence, Jackson and southwestern Jennings Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 948 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brownstown to 12 miles southeast of Bedford. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Lawrence, Jackson and southwestern Jennings Counties, including the following locations... Vallonia, Medora, Norman, Pleasant View, Spring Mill State Park, Tunnelton, Freetown, Kurtz, Cortland and Crothersville. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 37 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
